CatDescriptText: Loretta Griffin, 406 Grove Street and Rowena Doggins, 2457 Waring Court, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 11, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that all bingo games, including those for the benefit of churches, veteran's groups, or hospitals, should be outlawed?" Ms. Griffin's answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  For those who like it, the games are all right because they give them some place to go."  Mrs. Doggins' answer reads: "Yes, I do, because it's gambling all the way.  I know a woman who had seven children - I think she now has eight - who used to buy a loaf of bread and 30 cents worth of bo...for her children and then, go to ...bingo game at a church."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Loretta Griffin wearing jacket, standing in front of C. A. Michel store, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Rowena Doggins wearing eyeglasses and half round hat with flowers, standing in front of C.A. Michel store, Smithfield Street, Downtown
